name: Rajma Masala
history: Rajma Masala, a North Indian dish, has its roots in Punjabi cuisine. It's a beloved comfort food, combining kidney beans with a hearty, spiced gravy.
description: Rajma Masala is a popular vegetarian dish made with red kidney beans cooked in a thick, spicy gravy. It's rich in flavors, with tomatoes, onions, and a blend of aromatic spices.

instructions.title: Soak and Cook the Rajma
instructions.description: Soak the rajma overnight in water. Drain and cook in a pressure cooker until soft.

instructions.title: Prepare the Masala
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. SautÃ© until onions are golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomato Puree
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a minute, then add tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.

instructions.title: Add Cooked Rajma
instructions.description: Add cooked rajma to the masala. Add water to adjust the consistency and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and cook for another minute.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread.

tips: Ensure the rajma is well cooked before adding to the masala.
Adjust the consistency of the curry according to your preference.
variations: Add cream or coconut milk for a richer gravy.
Include other beans like black beans or chickpeas for variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a clay bowl for a rustic presentation.
Garnish with a wedge of lemon for added zest.
